result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement /s/ PB 06/08/22

Defendant Christopher Charles Brandl in court.  Attorney John P Runde in court for Christopher Charles Brandl.  Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

3:53 PM Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea and sentencing hearing today.
There was a deferred entry of judgment agreement, filed with the Court. 
Court sees this agreement electronically.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

Atty Dodge addresses the Court prior to decision made by Court. Restitution has been paid. Defendant has no criminal history.
Atty Runde addresses the Court prior to decision made by Court.
Defendant addresses the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty of charge.
Clerk directed to WITHHOLD ENTRY of judgment of conviction this date.

BY THE COURT: 
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement, 9 months.

Court goes over the agreement with Defendant, specifically section 10. All bond conditions remain in effect.
Court signs agreement.

Atty Runde addresses housekeeping matters.
Proposed Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by Atty John Runde
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed by Atty John Runde
Matter set for P/S on 06/07/2022 at 3:30 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

State will file an information with the charges mirroring those in the complaint. 
Atty Runde concurs. 

NOT GUILTY plea entered. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

3:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Christopher Charles Brandl appeared in court, Attorney John P Runde for Christopher Charles Brandl appeared in court. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
No contact with Truck Shop USA.

01:28 PM Defendant Christopher Charles Brandl in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances. 

Court questions why Mr. Brandl did not appear for his last appearance.
Mr. Brandl makes statements. 

Court states bond will be set today.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court reviews the criminal complaint. 

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated.  

Adjourned Initial Appearance scheduled for: March 21st, 2022 @ 02:15p.m. in Branch 2.

Warrant canceled after Court by Judge Baker.
/s/MD 2-7-2022. (Notified ADA and HM as to signed warrant. az 2-8-2022)
Statewide

02:53 PM Defendant Christopher Charles Brandl not in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant with $250  cash alternative
Statewide
Initial Appearance set for February 7, 2022 @ 2:00 p.m. in Br 2
